fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While CWD-5401 is preventing the admin from adding an email subject prefix. However, if the email subject prefix is already been added to Crowd, it will not show in the password expiration reminder. Emails such as manual password reset or forgot username email *do* contain the configured subject prefix.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Configure email template for password expiration reminder (optional)
* Configure mail server
* Configure an arbitrary email subject prefix
* Set a reminder interval for password expiration reminders
* Wait for an email

h3. Expected Results
The subject prefix is showing in the password expiration reminder email

h3. Actual Results
The subject prefix is NOT showing in the password expiration reminder email

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Email subject prefix doesn't apply to password expiration reminder

fields.description:
h3. Request Summary

We have this option in other applications and it would be interesting to have this functionality for Crowd as well in the GUI. 

Currently, we can export it via REST API:
- https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-crowd/3.4.0/REST/#admin/1.0/auditlog-searchAuditLog

Or querying the related tables:
- *cwd_audit_log_entry* and *cwd_audit_log_changeset*.
fields.summary: Ability to export Audit Logs via GUI

fields.description:
h3. Description

+As a+ System Admin of a Crowd instance with a very high number of users and changes per day
 +I want to+ be able to filter Audit Log searches by Date and Time
 +So that+ I can see changes done only in a specific, more granular, timeframe
h3. Suggestion Summary

Currently we only allow filtering by Date, Crowd Sytem admins cannot filter by time.
 !audit-log-date.png!

[https://xdsoft.net/jqplugins/datetimepicker/#i18n]
h3. Proposed Solution

We could use a component like this to filter Audit logs:
 !audit-log-date-time.png!

As listed in: [https://xdsoft.net/jqplugins/datetimepicker/#startdateex]
h3. Possible Workarounds

None at the moment
fields.summary: Searching in Audit Log could filter by time, not only date

fields.description:
When using Crowd Datacenter, changing the license on one node will not refresh on the other nodes automatically even after waiting several hours.

The license is updated correctly on the shared_home/crowd.cfg.xml file.

h4. Expected behavior

Refreshing the licence page on each node should indicate the updated license in the UI.

h4. Proposed changes

Crowd nodes should read the license from the shared crowd.cfg.xml file when the license page UI is reloaded.

h4. Workaround

1) Restart the other nodes after updating the license on one node.
2) Update the license on each node manually.
fields.summary: Updating Crowd DC license doesn't reflect on the other nodes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This issue refers only to a connector directory (reproduced on Microsoft Active Directory).

In Crowd, If you add members to a group in a group details page, a remote directory won't be updated. Changes will be only persisted locally. But next Crowd sync with remote directory will override them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a specific group and add one or more members
 # Check a remote directory if members were added to a matching group

h3. Expected Results

In Crowd added users are present in the group. In remote directory, added users are present in the group.
h3. Actual Results

In Crowd added users are present in the group. In remote directory, added users are +not+ present in the group.
h3. Notes

I've reproduced this bug using Microsoft Active Directory. But it's likely that the behaviour is the same for other types of connector directories.

This bug also affects following Crowd REST endpoint:

POST /rest/admin/1.0/groups/\{groupId}/users
h3. Workaround

Instead of adding members to a group in a group details page, it's possible to add groups to each user in a user details page. The second flow works as expected.
fields.summary: Adding members to group won't update connector directory
